Build: I20050126

If IResource.isSynchronized() is called on a non-local resource, an internal
error occurs.  This happens because isSynchronized is not supposed to be able to
modify the tree, but RefreshLocalVisitor attempts to make non-local resources local.

Example error stack from auto-refresh:

org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.AssertionFailedException: Assertion failed: 
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:95)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree.openElementData(ElementTree.java:869)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.getResourceInfo(Workspace.java:1140)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.getResourceInfo(Resource.java:990)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.RefreshLocalVisitor.visit(RefreshLocalVisitor.java:268)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.UnifiedTree.accept(UnifiedTree.java:87)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.isSynchronized(FileSystemResourceManager.java:405)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.isSynchronized(Resource.java:1126)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.refresh.win32.Win32Monitor$Handle.postRefreshRequest(Win32Monitor.java:197)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.refresh.win32.Win32Monitor$ResourceHandle.handleNotification(Win32Monitor.java:286)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.refresh.win32.Win32Monitor.waitForNotification(Win32Monitor.java:579)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.refresh.win32.Win32Monitor.run(Win32Monitor.java:496)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

Fix released.  I factored out the code that marks the resource local into a
separate method, and overwrote this method in the CollectSyncStatusVisitor
subclass to avoid performing the modification.  Test case added to
regression.IResourceTest.
